comments:
I suppose the exception shouldn't appear in the error log.

It is a bit tedious to copy over include paths manually. 

A thought:

For "makefile projects" a target "showcdtinfo" or some such could be defined.
This target would print out information for CDT such as include paths.
I'm not too familiar with automake, but perhaps something like this already 
exists.





!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 sep 19, 2003 12:44:18.117
!MESSAGE Preprocessor Exception
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.cdt.core.parser.ScannerException: Inclusion not found: 
pkgconf/system.h
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.Scanner.handleInclusion
(Scanner.java:321)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.Scanner.poundInclude
(Scanner.java:2020)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.Scanner.nextToken
(Scanner.java:1010)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.Scanner.nextToken
(Scanner.java:603)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.Preprocessor.process
(Preprocessor.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.sourcedependency.DependencyTree.add
(DependencyTree.java:133)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.sourcedependency.AddFileToDependencyTree.addDocume
ntToTree(AddFileToDependencyTree.java:81)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.sourcedependency.AddFileToDependencyTree.execute
(AddFileToDependencyTree.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run
(JobManager.java:367)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Actually,
  I thing Bogdan is currently working on those issues(the exception
thrown by the DepencyTree).

The other one to automatically find the include paths, few
projects are in the way(the mananged make) and others.

Reassign to bogdan for the log exception.
PR was not targeted to any particular release. Changing target milestone to 2.1

We now have scanner config functionality for standard projects which sets up the
includes after doing a build, and the managed project automatically adds the
standard include directories.


- BG
